comments:
Assume that you have a nature X which is dependent on Nature Z. When we try and uninstall the nature Z, without uninstalling nature X, an exception is thrown with the message saying that Z is a prerequisite of X, and hence we cannot uninstall Z

Consider the scenario when we create a "Static Web Project" called ProjectA using WTP. This project installs a nature called "org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ModuleCoreNature". I create another facet which installs a nature called "anotherFacet.NewNature" to the existing project. This NewNature REQUIRES "org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ModuleCoreNature" as a constraint.
If I try to convert the projectA to a dynamic web project, by right clicking ProjectA in project explorer, and clicking on Static Web Project > Convert to Dynamic Web Project, I get an exception (in the .log file) which has two messages "
!MESSAGE Failed while uninstalling Static Web Module 1.0." "!MESSAGE Cannot remove nature org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ModuleCoreNature because it is a prerequisite of nature com.ibm.etools.siteedit.WebSiteNature."

Reason: This exception is thrown because the uninstall delegate of Simple Web Module (org.eclipse.wst.project.facet.SimpleWebFacetUninstallDelegate.execute) tries to remove "org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ModuleCoreNature" nature without checking if it has any dependant natures.

To reproduce the above mentioned issue, I have created a plugin called anotherFacet. It was developed on All in One WTP SDK 1.5.3 (wtp-all-in-one-sdk-R-1.5.3-win32.zip). Copy the plugin anotherFacet_1.0.0.jar to the plugins directory and invoke eclipse. 
Perform the following steps to reproduce the error:
1. Create a Static Web Project called ProjectA. (Do Not select any runtime)
(Note: Check the .project file of ProjectA. It will have two entries for natures
	<nature>org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.nature</nature>
	<nature>org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ModuleCoreNature</nature>)
2. Right click on ProjectA in the project explorer to invoke the context menu and click on properties.
3. Select Project Facets from the tree view and click on the button Add/Remove Project Facets...
4. In the "Add/Remove Project Facets..." Dialog Box you will see an entry called "Test Facet 1.0". Check the check box next to it.
5. Click on Finish
6. Click on OK.
7. Check the .project file of ProjectA. It will have three entries for natures
	<nature>anotherFacet.NewNature</nature>
	<nature>org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.nature</nature>
	<nature>org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ModuleCoreNature</nature>
(Note: The plugin anotherFacet has added the nature anotherFacet.NewNature which requires "org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ModuleCoreNature")

8. Right click on ProjectA. Select Static Web Project --> Convert to Dynamic Web Project. Select Web Module Version =2.3.
9. Open the .log file of the workspace and you will see the following exception trace.

Created an attachment (id=60053)
Contains the plugin which helps in reproduction of the bug

Use this plugin according to the steps described in the bug description to reproduce the bug
I understand the problem, but I don't understand what you expect the behavior to be. Could you clarify?

Re-reading the problem statement, I now understand the problem to be specific to static to dynamic project conversion and not a general comment about natures. 

This is a fundamental limitation in how WTP represents static and dynamic projects using separate facets and can manifest in other ways as well. There is an enhancement request open that tracks changing the facets for static and dynamic web projects so that a dynamic web project looks more like an extension of a static web project. That means that it will not be necessary to uninstall any facets in order to convert a static web project into a dynamic one. I will dupe this bug against that enhancement request.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 173901 ***
Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.
